p: Because records of population structure in each considered population are missing, we assumed that each population of plains zebra have a similar population structure at the start of the simulations as found in Georgiadis et al. [ 16]. As such, at the start of each simulation, the population included 16% foals, 25% juveniles, 24% adult males and 35% adult females, with a general male-to-female ratio of 0.7.
